definition: Yuan Shao (153-202), general during late Han, subsequently warlord
long robe (old)
surname Yuan
surname Shao
to continue/to carry on

sentences.english: But Yuan Shao was dissatisfied, he does not like the idea of depending on someone to send him provisions.
sentences.chinese: 袁紹覺得等待別人送糧草，不能夠解決根本問題。

sentences.english: Cao Cao's army harried his rear guard.
sentences.chinese: 袁紹退軍急回，背後曹軍趕來。

sentences.english: Yuan Shao dispatched troops to occupy most of Dongjun after a long time siege.
sentences.chinese: 袁紹出兵經長期圍攻重新佔據東郡大部。

definition: Liu Biao (142-208), warlord
Lu Su or Lu Zijing 魯子敬|鲁子敬 (172-217), statesman, diplomat and strategist of Eastern Wu 東吳|东吴
to go on a punitive expedition
Fu Jian (338-385), emperor of Former Qin 前秦[Qian2 Qin2], reigning from 357-385
Emperor Xian of Han (181-234), the final Han emperor, set up by Dong Zhuo 董卓, reigned 189-220, forced to abdicate 220 by Cao Pi 曹丕
Wuhuan (nomadic tribe)
talented field commander (military)
commander-in-chief, the equivalent of king in Chinese chess
Sun Ce (175-200), general and major warlord of the Later Han Dynasty

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
Sun Quan (reigned 222-252), southern warlord and king of state of Wu 吳|吴 in the Three Kingdoms period
famous Song dynasty family of warriors (c. 10th century AD), resisted the Liao 遼|辽 and defended the Song/the subject of the popular fiction Yang Saga 楊家將|杨家将
first Sui emperor (541-604) Yang Jian (541-604), reigned 581-604
Song of the Southern dynasties 南朝宋 (420-479), with capital at Nanjing
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
Western Jin dynasty 西晋 historian, author of History of the Three Kingdoms 三國志|三国志
